Comments_List: I learnt a lot about the field of legal history today, its major topics and methods
Gained fundamental knowledge of legal history approaches and theories, as well as how they are integrated into many areas of global scholarship.
Approaches to doing legal history and insights to the roles law plays in society.
I developed a deep thematic understanding of the terrain of legal historiography. The course was well laid out to give a theoretical and geographically comprehensive approach to legal history.
A lot of emphasis on theory and using the legal archive.
Overview of historians, anthropologists and other scholars writing about legal history.  Engagement with both narrative and theoretical works.
It was a very engaging seminar, discussions were always interesting

super great set up with each week being themed but chronologically and geographically diverse.

in class discussions were helpful and very interesting, I liked how the professors moved through each reading during each class, it was well structured.

more readings online (articles or scans) would have been helpful because the books could be hard to find for most of the class in time. also, perhaps a smaller assignment or mid-course feedback on how we are doing would be helpful before going into the final assignments.

This course was the best I have taken at Yale thus far. De and Antonov and incredibly giving professors. Readings were a bit much, but still manageable, and seminar discussions were always meaningful.

Strengths - structure and theoretical exploration. Ambitious reading list.

Weaknesses - some class discussions were too broad, not enough practical use of archives.

I loved this class.  It would have been helpful to have assignments finalized at least a week in advance, as that caused some confusion.  But the professors provided a great compliment to one another and lead interesting discussions.
Yes, this class is a great way to get an overview of the field of legal history
yes! super interesting materials and a way to improve your historical skills while learning more about the field of legal history.
Absolutely! Most challenging and interesting graduate course I have taken thus far.
Yes  very interesting seminar topics and good discussions in class.
Absolutely: great intro to legal history.
Yes.  But mostly for those with a serious interest in the law or using legal sources in their work.
